lines.content: Application allows users to add, delete, mark as done 3 different type of tasks(ToDos, Events and Deadline).
Lists out all task that is previously stored.
The task are displayed with its type as well as its doneness.
Here are the tasks in your list:
It marks the task at the specified number to be done.
The task from the list corresponding to the number will be marked done.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Creates a new todo task adding to the back of the list.
A new todo task is added to the back of the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Creates a new event task adding to the back of the list with timing specified by /at.
Timing is to be specified in a yyyy-mm-dd format
A new event task is added to the back of the list with timing specified by /at.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Creates a new deadline task adding to the back of the list with timing specified by /by.
Timing is to be specified in a yyyy-mm-dd format
A new deadline task is added to the back of the list with timing specified by /by.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
* Class Constructor with the description and time of the task.
* @param by time the task needs to be completed by.
* Returns the String representation of a Deadline task.
* @return String representation of a Deadline task.
* Returns the String representation of a Deadline task for storage purpose.
* @return String representation of a Deadline task for storage purpose.
* Class that is a chat bot that can store tasks.
private enum Commands {list, done, todo, event, deadline, delete, find }
* Class Constructor based on where the storage file path.
* @param filePath where the storage file is at.
* Driver function that runs the chat bot.
* Function that checks whether the user wants to exit the program.
* @param instruction instruction given by the user
* @return a boolean on whether the program should terminate
* Class that represent all errors/exceptions that are unique to the chat bot.
* Returns a String message indicating an error.
* Class Constructor with the description and time of the task.
* @param at time the task is at.
* Returns the String representation of a Event task.
* @return String representation of a Event task.
* Returns the String representation of a Event task for storage purpose.
* @return String representation of a Event task for storage purpose.
* Represents the error when there is missing information after a command.
* Constructor that takes in the command in String form.
* @param error which command the user inputted.
* Returns a String representation of the error with the corresponding command.
return super.toString() + "The description of a " + command + " cannot be empty.";
* Class to represent parsing the commands
private enum Commands {list, done, todo, event, deadline, delete, find }
* Method that parses instruction from the user.
* @throws NoDescriptionError If user inputs nothing after a task command.
* @throws UnknownCommandError If user inputs a command that is outside the scope of the chatbot
public static void parse(String instruction, Ui ui, TaskList tasks) throws NoDescriptionError, UnknownCommandError{
* Class that encapsulates the file reading/writing for the storage of tasks.
* Class Constructor that takes in the file path of the storage file.
* @param filePath where the storage file is at.
* Reads the file of the storage and returns a ArrayList of Tasks from the storage.
* @return ArrayList of Task that is stored.
* Function that parses the line that is stored in the storage file.
* @param task line in the file that represents a task.
* @return Task object corresponding to the line in the file.
* Clears the file to avoid appending of the same tasks.
* Function that writes a line to file.
* Class Constructor that creates a task based on the description.
* Returns a X or nothing depending on whether the task is done.
* @return an indicator on the doneness of the class.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns a String representation of the Task.
* Returns a String to be written in the storage file.
* @return String form of the task to be written in the storage file.

* Deletes a task based on the index.

* Retrieves the task at the given index.

* Returns a new Tasklist with tasks matching keyword.

* Class that handles all user interaction.
* Responsible for outputs as well as reading inputs from users.
private static final Scanner USER_INPUT = new Scanner(System.in);
private static final  String GREETING = "Hello! I'm Duke\n" + "What can I do for you?";
private static final String FAREWELL = "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";
private static final String LIST_MESSAGE = "Here are the tasks in your list:";
private static final String DONE_MESSAGE = "Nice! I've marked this task as done:";
private static  final String ADD_TASK_MESSAGE = "Got it. I've added this task:";
private static final String DELETE_TASK_MESSAGE = "Noted. I've removed this task:";
private static final String FIND_TAKS_MESSAGE = "Here are the matching tasks in your list:";

* Prints a notifcation which informs the user

* Prints a message of how many task are in the task list.
System.out.println("Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints a message informing the user of an error that has occured.
* Error is specific to the chat bot itself.
* @param e Duke Exception that has occurred.
* Repressents the error when the user inputs an unknown command
* Returns a String representation of the error.
return super.toString() + "I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(";
